page.title: 02 Agriculture
page.content: The area is predominantly covered by water and marshes but farming is a significant activity on almost all suitable land.On the Motney Hill peninsula the land, leased from the water authority, is mainly used for arable crops especially wheat and barley but a hay crop is taken from low-lying water meadows on the eastern side.South of the coastal road there is a 1Km belt used mainly for tree crops,apples, pears, cherries with some strawberries.North of the coast road extending to the sea wall there is rough graziing for a few sheep and horses.Farms are generally small and some of the land is in smallholdings producing fruit and vegetables for local consumption. Almost all this land is classified Grade 1 by the Ministry. The emphasis on horticultural crops is typical of much of North West Kent.
